title: Pound gains on rate rise optimism - BBC News
summary: trump to ' fed chair this week ' .
goldman chief warns on uk office .
uk mortgage lending slows in september .
dulux owner akzo nobel considers merger .

documents.title: good night !
text: that 's all we have time for tonight on business live - thanks for reading .
we are back as always bright and early on tuesday at 0600 .
do join us then .

documents.title: aramco listing 'not in doubt '
text: the international listing of shares in saudi arabia 's state oil firm - which is being billed as the largest ipo ever - will go ahead , according to the head of the hong kong stock exchange .

saudi arabia plans to list up to 5 % of the world 's largest oil producer on the saudi stock exchange in riyadh , the tadawul , and also one or more international markets , potentially raising as much as $ 100bn .
the listing has not been without its problems - with investor unease in london , and reports that saudi authorities could opt for a private sale to china instead .
`` there will be ( an international listing ) - the issue is when .
it 's beyond any doubt in my mind , '' said charles li , chief executive of hong kong exchanges and clearing .

documents.title: sweet farewell for rosenfeld
text: the maker of tasty treats such as cadbury chocolate and oreos biscuits , mondelez international , has posted better than expected quarterly profit and revenue following higher sales in europe and latin america .
it was the last quarter for the world 's second largest confectionary company under chief executive irene rosenfeld , who sold its kraft grocery business in 2012 .
mondelez net sales rose 5.6 % to $ 4.77bn , while net profit soared 81 % to $ 992m for the three months to 30 september .

documents.title: what does brexit mean for our bacon ?
text: breakfast business presenter steph mcgovern is in denmark to find out what brexit might mean for a full english .
tune in tomorrow morning .

documents.title: 'not a step into the unknown '
text: a lot has been written about how a uk rate rise - if it goes ahead on thursday - would be the first in 10 years .
but we should n't be worried , according to one former member of the bank of england 's monetary policy committee .
andrew sentance , who 's now an economist at pwc and argues in favour of raising rates , said :
surely a uk rate rise from 0.25 to 0.5pc is not a step into the unknown '' .
bank rate was 0.5pc from mar 2009 until aug 2016 !
@ twitterid interest rates north of 5 % for 50yrs ( 1950-2000 ) , 15-20 % at times .
you youngsters eh , never seen a real mortgage challenge ?
higher interest rates are fine if wage increases also occur
or if tax thresholds increase , it 's net pay we should be concerned about
with hindsight ( and probably at the time ) drop to.25 % was an error , resulting from groupthink about brexit being a disaster
mortgage rate was 14 % when we bought our house .
# nocarpetsfortwoyears
@ twitterid spend a little time reviewing the posts and blogs of @ twitterid
i remember living through double-digit interest and inflation rates .
suddenly interest rates at.5 % and inflation at 3 % are a calamity .
does n't give you overmuch confidence in reuters
double rates .

documents.title: wall street drops
text: us stock markets have pulled back from record-high territory , with analysts pointing to falls in healthcare stocks and potential delays to president trump 's planned tax cuts .
the dow jones index fell 0.4 % to 23,348.74 , while the s & p 500 dropped 0.3 % to 2,572.83 .
drugmaker merck was among the top fallers after reporting a setback to its key cancer medicine , dragging down other healthcare shares .
us stocks extended their losses after bloomberg reported that lawmakers were discussing a gradual phase-in for a corporate tax cut that trump and his fellow republicans favoured .
the nasdaq index fell back from a record high to finish 2 points lower at 6,698.96 .

documents.title: netflix on spacey
text: streaming service netflix has announced that house of cards - the political thriller starring kevin spacey - will end next year .
it comes on the same day that spacey apologised after being accused of making a sexual advance towards a child actor 30 years ago .

documents.title: one rate rise ?
text: the pound has gained against the euro and dollar on the back of rising expectations that the bank of england will increase interest rates for the first time in a decade .
the futures markets are giving a 90 % chance that bank governor mark carney and the other interest rate setters will raise rates to 0.5 % on thursday , says etx capital analyst neil wilson .
that 's the level it was at before the brexit vote last june .
but the bigger question , mr wilson , says , is will a hike be the start of more rate rises , or will it be a case of `` one-and-done '' ?

documents.title: page turner
text: what makes a best-selling writer tick ?
lee child gave some insights to bbc world service when they visited his writing room to record the first three days ' work on his next novel .
the british author has made an estimated £ 40m fortune from his novels about american policeman jack reacher .
`` this is not admired literature , this is entertainment '' - @ twitterid

documents.title: v festival and virgin part ways
text: sir richard branson 's virgin has pulled the plug on its sponsorship of v festival , 22 years after it was founded .
another company is expected to take virgin 's role in sponsoring the music event - which was headlined by us singer pink this year .
v festival - short for virgin festival - will continue under a new name .
richard branson said it was time for a change .
# vfest has been an incredible experience but it 's time to change things up

documents.title: spanish shares rally
text: spain 's stock index has finished as the biggest riser in europe , after shares rebounded on increasing hopes that catalonia wo n't break away .
the ibex in madrid rose 2.4 % as investors were reassured by weekend demonstrations for a unified spain and a poll lead for parties opposed to catalan independence .
meanwhile , spain 's chief prosecutor has called for charges including rebellion - which carries a maximum 30 year jail term - to be brought against catalan leaders .
deposed catalan president carles puigdemont is reported to have left the region , and is in brussels meeting with politicians and lawyers .

documents.title: rate rise is 'priced in '
text: while nothing is absolutely certain , it appears that a 0.25 percentage point rate rise on thursday has been largely priced in by the market .
`` it will be a major , major surprise if the bank did n't hike interest rates on thursday , '' says ing currency strategist viraj patel .

`` it would certainly be catastrophic for sterling , because speculation of that rate hike has provided a floor for sterling and stopped it from sliding lower you take away that support and it 's like pulling the rug out from under sterling 's feet , '' he adds .
bringing rates back to 0.5 % might be the only rise for some time , ubs says , given the weak state of the uk economy .
tighter monetary police from the bank of england should take sterling up to about $ 1.36 , the investment bank adds .

documents.title: airline calls for an easybrexit
text: easyjet is hoping for a `` straightforward and simple '' agreement on uk-eu flights when brexit takes place in march 2019 , a director for the airline says .
sophie dekkers , uk director at easyjet , told mps on the transport committee there is `` enough time between now and next autumn to get a deal in place '' .
in the meantime , the airline is showing its commitment to the uk by increasing services , she said .
the airline set up a new company in austria to cover its flights between eu countries - but that wo n't see operations being moved there , ms dekkers added .

documents.title: sterling hits four-week high
text: the pound has made strong gains on the back of expectations that the bank of england will raise interest rates for the first time in over a decade this week .
sterling hit a four-week high against the euro at 87.93 pence per euro - although it later eased back slightly .
it 's 0.6 % higher against the dollar at 75.73 pence per dollar .

documents.title: rev it up
text: jim ratcliffe - one of the uk 's richest men - does n't seem to be stopping at plans to launch his own 4-wheel drive .
he 's also snapping up the company that makes leather jackets for well-heeled bikers , according to times retail editor deirdre hipwell .
ratcliffe is a fan of high-octane travel apparently , having once gone on a motorbike trip across africa with three broken bones in his foot .
so oddest news today.jim ratcliffe 's ineos is buying belstaff group , motorbike jacket fashion retailer , from jab returning it to brit hands

documents.title: european flights 'will continue post-brexit '
text: a bit more on the prospects of eu-uk flights being grounded when britain leaves the european union .
willie walsh ( the boss of british airways owner iag , says that 's unlikely to happen .

chancellor philip hammond said earlier this month that if britain left the eu without a deal , this could theoretically lead to flights being grounded - and added it was clearly in the interest of all parties to avoid this .
`` the prospect of there being no flying between the uk and europe , i do n't agree with at all , '' walsh told mps .
`` this would bring all of europe to a standstill . ''

documents.title: brexit certainty 'not essential '
text: british airways will cope with any uncertainty in the run up to the uk leaving the european union , says willie walsh , the boss of the airline 's owner iag .
`` i 'm happy to operate in an area of uncertainty right up to the last minute , '' he has told mps on the transport committee .
more certainty around what effect brexit will have on flights between the uk and eu would be `` helpful '' , but he does n't believe it 's `` essential '' .
this industry often has new regulations imposed upon it at very short notice , he says .
`` you have to cope with it . ''

documents.title: joint deal
text: a clever company always has an eye on future growth and it may be that us booze distributor constellation brands now falls into that category .
the firm , which markets corona and modelo beers , has bought a 9.9 % stake in canadian cannabis company canopy growth corporation for c $ 245m ( $ 190m ) .
the investment follows constellation 's aim to `` identify , meet and stay ahead of evolving consumer trends and market dynamics '' .
however , it has no plans to sell any cannabis products in the us or other markets `` until it is legally permissible to do so '' .
canada is due to legalise cannabis next july .
medical marijuana is permitted in 29 states in the us , but recreational marijuana use is legal in only a handful thus far .
founded in 2014 , canopy is one of the main players in canadian cannabis with revenues of almost c $ 40m for the year to 31 march .
author: Chris Johnston
Business reporter, BBC News

documents.title: ftse finishes lower
text: the uk 's 100 share index has closed 17 points - or 0.2 % - lower at 7,487.81 , dragged down by companies that benefit from a stronger pound .
british american tobacco was the biggest faller - down about 2 % - while other firms which make most of their profits abroad , including diageo , also dropped .
the pound was up against the dollar and euro on the back of an expected rate rise from the bank of england later this week .

documents.title: i ca n't believe there 's a butter shortage
text: it 's good news for spanish berries ( see previous post ) , but not so much for french butter , apparently .
the bbc 's paris correspondent hugh schofield reports that there are butter shortages in french shops .
`` shelves are emptying .
supermarket own-brands have become scarce , and often it is only possible to find more expensive varieties for sale , '' he says .
so what 's causing it ?

documents.title: berry good
text: big news in the world of berries .
a uk private equity firm has plucked planasa , a spanish firm that specialises in the fruits , in a €450m deal .
london-headquartered cinven said it was taking a majority stake in the company , which sells seeds , plants and r & d services to farmers , and fresh produce to retailers across the world .
maxim crewe , a partner at cinven , said planasa would benefit from the `` strong growth in global berry consumption '' as shoppers look for healthier snacks and diets .

documents.title: wall street weighs russia probe charges
text: us stock markets are in negative territory as we head towards lunchtime in new york .
the dow jones index is down 0.3 % to 23,361 points , and the s & p 500 is also 0.3 % lower at 2,572 points .

the big news on wall street are the charges against donald trump 's former presidential campaign manager , paul manafort ( and one of his business associates , which stem from an inquiry into alleged russian meddling in the us election .
they do not relate to mr trump 's campaign but to the alleged concealment of payments from mr manafort 's ukrainian business dealings up to 2016 .

documents.title: hinkley point averts strike
text: a potential strike by hundreds of construction workers at the new hinkley point nuclear power plant has been avoided after they accepted a revised pay deal .
under the improved pay deal workers will receive pay levels up to 36 % above minimum pay rates and see holiday pay , overtime and pension contributions increase , the gmb union said .
hinkley point will be britain 's first new nuclear plant in a generation , but has been beset by years of delays over financing and government support .

documents.title: who else is in the fed frame ?
text: in case you want to find out more about who president trump is considering for head of the us federal reserve , we 've put together a handy guide to the runners and riders .
click here to see profiles of the five candidates he interviewed for the top job .

documents.title: who 's the favourite for fed job ?
text: so now it looks like we 'll get a decision on who donald trump wants to chair the us central bank on thursday .
trump 's for the most powerful job in economics will have a big impact on his ambitions for us economic growth , and on the world of finance .
in recent weeks jerome powell - an existing member of the fed board - has emerged as the favourite to replace current chair janet yellen .
seen as a safe pair of hands by the markets , he 's been a governor on the federal reserve board since 2012 and has never cast a dissenting vote on monetary policy .
`` he checks all the boxes , '' says omair sharif , senior us economist at societe generale .
he 's been a republican adviser , offers stability , backs low interest rates , and is open to deregulation of the financial sector , mr sharif explains .

documents.title: trump 's fed 'on thursday '
text: president donald trump is expected to announce his choice to chair the federal reserve on thursday , a white house official has said .
it 'll be the day after the fed 's latest meeting , and the day before trump flies to asia for a major diplomatic mission .
he 's interviewed five candidates for the role .
from left to right above : kevin warsh , john taylor , gary cohn , jeremy powell , and janet yellen .

documents.title: cheques going digital
text: do you still use cheques ?
from today they 'll start to be processed within a day as banks and building societies finally start to use 21st century technology .
at present cheques are still processed through a centuries-old paper-based clearing system .
but from today , images of cheques will start to be used , meaning they can be transmitted quickly and cleared within a working day .
customers who receive a cheque will be able to use a banking app to snap it and send it to their bank saving a trip to a branch to a deposit it .
the new system is being rolled out from today and should completely replace the paper-based clearing - in which cheques take a week to clear - from summer 2018 .

documents.title: show us the moneythe bbc 's douglas fraser looks at the so-called divorce bill for brexit
text: £ 18bn , €100bn , £ 79bn , zero ?
sorting through the muddle of what the uk will have to pay as it brexits .
blogged :

documents.title: got £ 12m to spare ?
text: for only the fourth time in its 100-year history knockdrin castle in county westmeath , ireland is up for sale .
it might look like a castle , but it 's a georgian country house , which includes winston churchill among its former guests .
for the €13.5m ( £ 12m ) price tag you also get 1,140 acres of land , including 100 acres of lakes .

documents.title: the importance of credit cards
text: the bbc world service recently asked listeners of the series 50 things that made the modern economy to vote for the 51st `` thing '' that they felt was really important , and they overwhelmingly voted for the credit card .
here 's a video tracing this must-have item 's history :
should you be trusted with a credit card ?
hear the full story from @ twitterid
education fails to prepare kids for reality - wasting time w/religion when science , math & personal financial mgmt needed
israeli terrorists close pal media.pa accuses israel of blatant aggression of all intern laws as 8companies targeted
author: BBC World Service

documents.title: croatia keen to join eurozone
text: croatia is keen to adopt the euro within the next seven to eight years , prime minister andrej plenkovic told an economic conference on monday .
we do n't want to specify the exact dates , but we want croatia to become a euro zone member within two government terms in office , '' said plenkovic .
croatia seeks to enter the european exchange rate mechanism ii ( erm-2 ) within the next three years , before the country takes the presidency of the european union in 2020 .
the croatian national bank is preparing a report on the benefits and possible risks of entering the eurozone that is expected to be published soon .

documents.title: taking control
text: a chinese government agency has decided to take control of regional gdp growth figures , because provincial governments keep issuing contradictory gdp statistics that far exceed the national output .
regional government officials are believed to be falsifying data because their career advancement is tied to economic growth , officials said .
from 2019 , the national bureau of statistics ( nbs ) will take over publishing both regional and national gdp figures .
`` the gap between collected regional and national gdp data is still not small , '' said nbs ' deputy head li xiaochao .
`` it also affects the credibility of government statistics . ''

documents.title: goldman sachs boss tweets on brexit
text: business editor simon jack tweets :
goldman sachs boss takes to twitter again to talk brexit .
he tweets about little else these days .

documents.title: sexism and the city
text: the financial conduct authority 's most senior female regulator says she was sexually harrassed in the workplace while working in the city during the 1990s and 2000s .

megan butler told the daily mail she was subjected to `` 'a complete range , from casual patting on the bum , hands up skirts , all the way through to 'if you do this for me i can make your career go well ' '' .

she said she told her husband about it , but other than that , no one talked about sexual harassment in the workplace , and only twice in her career did she see anyone speak out about being sexually harassed .

documents.title: new boss for asda
text: there 's been a change at the top for asda .
roger burnley is to succeed sean clarke as chief executive next year .
mr burnley was lined up to be chief executive when he joined asda from sainsbury 's in october 2016 .
independent retail analyst , steve dresser says that mr clarke has a decent job .
interesting to see where sean clarke ends up within wal-mart , has done an admirable job steadying the ship .
the market remains difficult

documents.title: building firms lead ftse 100 lower
text: the ftse 100 has been drifting lower this morning .
it 's down 0.35 % at 7,478 .
berkeley group shares are the biggest losers with a 2 % fall .
it follows a downgrade of uk building firms by analysts at barclays .
they note that building shares have jumped this year and perhaps are higher than the outlook justifies .
`` very strong share price performance leaves little scope for disappointment and we believe expectations of further government measures could be overblown , '' the research note says .

documents.title: uk tax deadline approaches
text: tomorrow is the deadline for completing a paper-based self-assessment return .
forms must be returned to the tax authorities by 31 october , warns chas roy-chowdhury , head of taxation at the association of chartered certified accountants .
while the majority of people now complete their return online there is still a sizeable number who choose the paper method , '' he points out .
it 's important people get their return in on time , even if they reckon they have no tax to pay .
late paper returns will incur a fine of at least £ 100 .

the paper deadline is particularly important this year for those using older computers and browsers , as hmrc systems will now only allow filing of online returns through more recent technology , '' mr roy-chowdhury warns .
while the move to more secure browsers is a sensible one , it may come as an unwelcome shock to those who might be faced with upgrading technology that they do n't really understand . ''

documents.title: debt rising
text: bank of england consumer credit statistics published this morning showed that consumer borrowing climbed 9.9 % to £ 204bn in the year to september 2017 .
while the growth is in line with previous months - it grew 10 % in the 12 months to august - the figure is alarming , warned gillian guy , chief executive of citizens advice .
she called for the city watchdog to take action to help struggling people .

the fca must step in to curb the worrying rise in debt - by banning credit card firms from pushing more credit onto people who have n't asked for it , and compelling them to offer support sooner when it 's clear people ca n't pay , '' she said .

documents.title: bitcoin hits all-time high of $ 6,300
text: the cryptocurrency rose to $ 6,306.58 on the coindesk bitcoin price index on sunday night , a 900 % jump in value compared with this time last year .
but it 's unclear how much of an appetite there is for this growth to continue - this morning prices are hovering at around just under $ 6,200 across several global exchanges .

documents.title: the sun counts the cost of motoring
text: british drivers have to fork out almost £ 44bn a year to the uk government in fuel duty , taxes and penalties , according to an investigation by the sun .
this works out at roughly £ 1,183 per driver , and due to fuel duty and vat , uk drivers currently pay the highest price at the pump in europe and the highest tax per litre .
the sun surveyed 10,000 drivers , and over half of motorists say they have had to change their lifestyle in order to be able to afford to keep driving .
but despite the amounts of money given to the government , the quality of roads in the uk trails far behind many poorer countries , ranking only 27th in the world , the report says .

documents.title: shares in apple suppliers shoot up
text: apple 's major suppliers have seen their shares shoot up in value on the european markets , following strong pre-order demand for the iphone x on friday .
ams , which supplies apple with chips , saw its shares jump 29.8 % on monday , followed by chipset manufacturer stmicroelectronics , whose stocks rose to 20.3 % .
dialog , another chipset manufacturer , saw its shares rise 7.2 % .

documents.title: mortgage lending slows in september
text: mortgage approvals in the uk fell to 66,232 in september , according to the latest statistics from the bank of england .
that 's the lowest number since june .
meanwhile , growth in unsecured lending , which includes credit card lending , was 9.9 % - down slightly from the 10 % growth rate in august .

documents.title: nintendo nearly doubles profit forecast
text: japanese gaming giant nintendo has forecast a major turnaround in its fortunes , nearly doubling its full-year profit outlook .
it expects profits of 120 billion yen ( £ 803m ) for the year ending in march - up from 65 billion yen estimated three months ago .
nintendo has raised the sales forecast for its switch console from 10 million units to 14 million .
market analyst sam reynolds from idc in taiwan said if the sales continue , the switch is on track to outsell the wii u by the end of its first year on the market .
but he added while there is much hype around the hybrid console , a lack of supply in dram memory chips is hampering supply .

mr reynolds said the revised profit forecast was `` pretty optimistic '' , but with black friday and christmas around the corner , the firm could have a stellar next quarter if it could overcome those issues .

documents.title: bank of england 'needs to think creatively '
text: inequality in the uk has been made worse by the bank of england 's policy to keep interest rates very low , says robert peston political editor at itv ( and formerly economics editor at the bbc ) .
low interest rates have driven up the cost of houses and financial assets , which has benefited the well-off , much more than the poorer members of society , mr peston argues .
it has also exacerbated regional inequality , he says .
average incomes in the north-east are half that of the south-east , mr peston points out .
he says the bank of england should think more creatively about tackling that problem , perhaps by channelling credit to more depressed areas .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: asia markets mixed with earnings eyed
text: it was a fairly muted session in asia , with japan faltering but still hovering near two-decade highs .
the benchmark nikkei 225 index ended flat at 22,011.67 .
in south korea , tech shares made ground .
samsung and sk hynix added 1.8 % and pushed the broader index higher .
the kospi added 0.2 % to close at 2,501.93 .
samsung is forecasting record quarterly profit when it delivers results on tuesday .
elsewhere in asia , hong kong 's hang seng index fell 0.4 % to 28,336.19 , while australia 's s & p/asx 200 put on 0.3 % to 5,919.1 .

documents.title: chancellor caught in a fiscal trap - ifs
text: the autumn budget is on the horizon , and experts say chancellor philip hammond has difficult decisions to make .
`` the chancellor has said he wants to get to budget balance by the mid-2020s , that 's going to require him to continue to cutting spending or increasing taxes .
but of course , all the pressure is to do quite the reverse , '' paul johnson , director of the institute for fiscal studies told the today programme .

`` there 's no chance of getting any tax increases through parliament , and the demands for more money for the nhs , increase pay for public sector workers , potentially to reverse the very large benefit cuts coming through the pipeline
`` those demands are very big , but if he cedes to any of those , then he 's saying he 's not taking seriously the fiscal rules he 's supposedly set himself . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: investors 'confident ' of no catalonia split
text: this is what analysts at bank of tokyo-mitsubishi make of the spanish situation .

`` there appears little evidence that tensions in catalonia are undermining confidence in spanish government bonds , which reflects strong investor confidence that catalonia will not split from spain .
however , it is a fluid situation that needs to be monitored closely . ''

documents.title: 'temporary ' reprieve for spanish markets .
text: neil wilson from etx capital has this comment on the spanish markets this morning .
`` tensions have been put on ice for a while after madrid took direct control and a major unionist rally over the weekend .
`` but this is likely to be temporary with elections due in december .
for now , it seems that investors are prepared to look on the bright side , albeit with due caution .
`` the ibex remains in a fairly steady downtrend since may and , with no end in sight for catalonia , political considerations should continue to weigh on the index . ''

documents.title: spanish financial markets steady
text: spanish shares have risen , despite the political turbulence over catalonia .
the benchmark ibex index is up 1.4 % .
banks in particular have gained ground .
meanwhile the cost of borrowing for spain has moved lower .
the yield on spanish 10-year bond is 1.48 % compared to 1.57 % at the close on friday .
analysts say that the markets steadied after a poll indicated that those political parties seeking independence for catalonia might lose their majority in regional elections due in december .
over the weekend there was a large demonstration in barcelona in favour of spanish unity ( see

documents.title: big deal in the paint business ?
text: the maker of dulux paint , akzo nobel , is considering a merger with us paintmaker axalta .
akzo said it is holding `` constructive discussions '' .
if successful the deal would create a giant in the coatings business .
axalta is particularly strong in coatings for trucks .

documents.title: ftse 100 moves lower
text: the ftse 100 is lower in early trading , down 0.25 % at 7,486 .
shares in hsbc holdings have eased 0.6 % lower after it released its latest earnings update .
easyjet shares are more than 1 % higher after it announced plans to snap up parts of air berlin .
miner , glencore was down 0.8 % after a trading update .

documents.title: allsaints eyeing china
text: allsaints has seen its sales grow by 20 % year-on-year to £ 303m , thanks to overseas sales .
the uk fashion retailer now makes 47 % of its sales from international markets , with a third of sales coming from asia , up 135 % to £ 19m .
in 2016 , all saints opened 74 new stores globally , including new branches in japan and south korea .
the fashion brand now has a presence in 27 countries , and is ramping up its presence in asia in order to appeal to chinese tourists , before pushing ahead with plans to launch stores in china .

documents.title: novartis bids for cancer treatment firm
text: swiss drugs giant novartis has made an offer for france 's advanced accelerator applications ( aaa ) , which develops technology for diagnosing and treating cancer .
the deal is worth $ 3.9bn .
aaa has a treatment for gastroenteropancreatic neuroendocrine tumours , the kind of cancer that killed apple founder steve jobs .

documents.title: fishing for news
text: all the latest fishing updates from wake up to money presenter sean farrington .
busy morning for business news from the 7 o'clock company announcements .
two fishing shops to open in slough and stoke .
good to see you 've given them some publicity on twitter .
could say they 've got you hook , line and sinker ( coat , i 'll get )
# accidentalpartridge

documents.title: robotics could threaten one million jobs
text: robotics , 3d printing and artificial intelligence could help propel the uk economy into a so-called fourth industrial revolution says a report led by the chief executive of siemens ( uk and ireland ) , professor juergen maier .
however that technology will displace some jobs , says prof maier .
the uk can ready itself for that situation with more training .
one million workers in manufacturing need `` up-skilling '' he told the today programme .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: easyjet confirms air berlin deal
text: easyjet has confirmed that it is to buy up a chunk of the business of failed airline air berlin for €40m ( £ 35.3m ) .
the budget airline will lease up to 25 a320 aircraft , offering employment to air berlin flying crews and taking over other assets including landing slots at berlin tegel airport .
easyjet has launched a recruitment campaign to attract around 1,000 of air berlin 's pilots and cabin crew , who will be employed on local german contracts .
the carrier will operate a reduced timetable at tegel airport during the winter , but plans to operate a full schedule from summer 2018 .
routes and services will be announced in due course .

documents.title: improving uk railways
text: today , all the train companies in the uk have come together to launch a `` single plan '' for britain 's railway .

`` there 's already a £ 50bn development plan going on , and over the next 18 months , that will see an unprecedented scale with more trains , better services , improvements to stations across the country , '' paul plummer , chief executive of rail delivery group told the today programme .
`` we know we need to do more than that .
this plan sets out four things - strengthening our commitment to the economy , improving customer satisfaction , boosting local communities right across the country and increasing jobs . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: hsbc reports strong results
text: hsbc has announced pre-tax quarterly profits of $ 4.6bn ( £ 3.5bn ) for the three months to the end of september , which is a five-fold increase from the same period a year ago .

`` it 's a spectacular set of results , but we do have to remember that this time last year , hsbc was in quite a lot of trouble so it 's coming off quite a low base , '' city index 's research director kathleen brooks told the today programme .
`` a lot of the increase in their profits was in asia , and strong banking results are really a sign of a strong economy - the asian economy is doing really well and firing on all cylinders .
`` hsbc is very much harnessing the powers of the growing middle classes in asia . ''

documents.title: how will business react to the catalan crisis ?
text: catalonia 's parliament voted to declare independence on friday .
in response spain 's central government took control of catalan institutions .
`` the network of businesses in catalonia are mostly small-medium businesses .

a majority of these small businesses are pro-independence , but the key is , how far will they go if their business is being affected , '' said rafael hortala-vallve , an associate professor in political science and public policy at london school of economics .
`` within society , the scar is going deeper and deeper , and for sure , this will not be good for businesses , `` he added .
`` we 're seing now a lot of businesses leaving catalonia , the spanish government says it 's 40 % of spanish businesses , but actually it might be only 25 % . ''
`` so far , i do n't think it 's affected much .
not much has happened . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: chancellor 'running out of options '
text: chancellor of the exchequer , philip hammond , will present his latest budget in a month 's time .

`` he 's beginning to run out of options if he wants to keep anything like the sorts of fiscal plans that he set himself at the election and at the last budget , '' says paul johnson , the director of the institute for fiscal studies ( ifs ) - a respected independent research organisation .
he 's either going to have to borrow more , or tell departments there 's no more money to spend .
raising taxes will be difficult for him to do , mr johnson told wake up to money .
what about higher wages for public sector workers ?
well , that 's expensive .
every 1 % increase costs well over a billion and a half pounds , points out mr johnson .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: who will be the next fed chief ?
text: towards the end of the week , president trump could announce the new chairman of the us federal reserve , the us central bank - also known as the fed .
it 's one the most important positions in the global financial system ( if not the most important ) .
at the moment it 's considered a race between jerome powell who is already on the board of governors of the fed , and john taylor an economist at stanford university .
mr taylor is considered to be `` hawkish '' which means more inclined to raise interest rates .
mr powell is considered to be less aggressive on rates .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: uk rates interest rates likely to head higher
text: on thursday the bank of england is expected to raise interest rates for the first time in ten years .

`` given that they 've cried wolf quite a few times now , if they do n't get on with it this time there will be some pretty stiff questions asked , '' said russ mould , investment director at aj bell .
he says debt has become the `` elephant in the room '' for central banks .
there 's a third more debt in the world than there was when the global financial crisis started ten years ago , says mr mould .
both government and consumer debt has risen sharply , which makes the economy much more sensitive to changes in interest rates , he says .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: good morning !
text: and welcome to monday 's business live page .
hsbc has reported strong quarterly profits , thanks to expansion in asia .
the chancellor of the exchequer philip hammond is in a tough spot as he prepares his latest budget according to the institute for fiscal studies .
( that budget is due on 22 november . )
central banks are also in the spotlight this week , as president trump is likely to name a new head for the us federal reserve and the bank of england could raise interest rates here in the uk .
author: Ben Morris
Business reporter
